result.execSummary:
The defendant Diego Raul Pichardo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Diego Raul Pichardo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Diego Raul Pichardo was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diego Raul Pichardo

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM
Defendant Diego Raul Pichardo in court.
Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan in court for Diego Raul Pichardo
Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Poss. w/Intent-THC, on or Near a Park;
Found guilty by the court; Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion. 
Parties waived the PSI report and proceeded to sentencing.
Ct 1:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions;
No sentence credit given.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. 
Defendant is eligible for expungement if he successfully completes probation.
Appeal rights given.
Expungment Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Sentencing mitigation letter filed by Atty Noonan.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Noonan.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney Noonan states that the DE just completed counseling and requests additional time to review the documents.  Status set for 10/25/22 @ 2:00.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

08:31 AM Defendant, Diego Raul Pichardo, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Noonan.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. needs time to complete his counseling.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.
